SEARCH
Package coffee.khyonieheart.origami.module

Interface ModuleManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
OrigamiModuleManager, OrigamiProviderPrimer, TestModuleProvider
public interface ModuleManager
Module manager interface, used to load and unload modules from .jar files into or out of memory. Implementations of module managers which automatically register commands and listeners should always respect PreventAutoLoad annotations.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Khyonie

  • Method Details

    • loadModule

      OrigamiModule loadModule(File moduleFile) throws IllegalArgumentException, FileNotFoundException, IOException, OrigamiModuleException
      Attempts to load a module into memory. This method should never return null, and implementations should always throw an exception rather than return as such.
      Parameters:
      moduleFile - A file containing a module.
      Returns:
      A module at the given location.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - The file does not exist.
      IllegalArgumentException - The moduleFile object is null.
      IOException - The file could not be accessed.
      InvalidModuleClassException - The proposed module class is not valid.
      OrigamiModuleException

    • getModule

      Option getModule(String moduleName)
      Attempts to obtain a loaded module instance with the given name.
      Parameters:
      moduleName - Name of module to obtain.
      Returns:
      See optional.

    • getGlobalClass

      Class<?> getGlobalClass(String name, ClassLoader accessor)

    • obtainModuleManager

      static ModuleManager obtainModuleManager(String sourcePath) throws FileNotFoundException, OrigamiModuleException
      Obtains a module manager instance from a provider source.
      Parameters:
      sourcePath - Provider source path (/, where "Source" translates to file .jar inside providers/modules/) // TODO Fix broken comment format
      Returns:
      A module manager.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - Provider file does not exist.
      OrigamiModuleException - Provider failed to be loaded or is in an invalid format.

      static File moduleFileWithName(String name)
